intro: Oreocharis guangwushanensis, commonly known as Guangwu Shan oreocharis, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique and delicate floral structure. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, showcasing its adaptability to challenging environments. Its flowers are usually small, with intricate patterns and vivid colors, attracting specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native region.
